CONJUGATES: noun: holes | verb: holes | holing | holed
ETYMOLOGY: From Old English 'hol' (a hollow place), from Proto-Germanic '*hulaz' (hollow), from Proto-IndoEuropean '*kel-' (to cover, conceal).

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An opening, gap, or hollow place in a solid body or surface.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 固体或表面上的开口、缝隙或空洞。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: There's a small hole in the wall where the picture used to hang.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 墙上挂画的地方有一个小洞。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A burrow or den, especially one made by an animal.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 动物挖掘的洞穴或巢穴。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The fox disappeared quickly into its hole.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 狐狸迅速钻进了它的洞穴。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A flaw, deficiency, or weakness in an argument, plan, or system.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 论点、计划或系统中的缺陷、不足或漏洞。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The detective found a significant hole in the suspect's alibi.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 侦探在嫌疑犯的不在场证明中发现了一个重大漏洞。

MEANINGS.PATTERN: a hole of a place | living in a hole
MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An unpleasant, dingy, or wretched place.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一个令人不快、肮脏或糟糕的地方。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: I can't believe they expect us to work in this dusty hole.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我真不敢相信他们竟然让我们在这个尘土飞扬的破地方工作。

MEANINGS.PATTERN: a golf hole | play a hole
MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The small cavity in the ground on a golf course into which the ball is played, or the entire section of a golf course from the tee to the putting green.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 高尔夫球场上球被打入的小洞，或从发球台到果岭的整个球道区域。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She managed to sink the ball on the first hole.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她在第一洞就成功将球击入洞中。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Transitive verb: A verb that takes one or more direct objects.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To make a hole or holes in something.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 在某物上打（或形成）一个洞。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The sharp rock holed the bottom of the canoe.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 尖锐的岩石在独木舟底部划出了一个洞。

REGISTER: Common in everyday language, with specific uses in sports or informal/derogatory contexts.
